org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jndi
Class OldJNDIReadConnector

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jndi.AbstractJNDIReadConnector
          org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jndi.OldJNDIReadConnector
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IReadConnector
Deprecated. by JNDIReadConnector. Candidate for deletion in the next major release.

public class OldJNDIReadConnector
extends AbstractJNDIReadConnector

This class is a connector which will generate IOrderedMaps from the results of a JNDI search.

It should be configured with an appropriate JNDIConnection and JNDISearch objects.

Author:
Eddy Higgins
See Also:
JNDIConnection, JNDISearch

setJndiConnection

public void setJndiConnection(JNDIConnection connection)
Deprecated. 
Assign a JNDI connection for use by the reader. Behaviour is undefiled if this is set when the reader has already called connect().

Parameters:
connection - The JNDIConnection to use

public javax.naming.directory.DirContext getContext()
Deprecated. 
Return the dirContext for this reader.

The dirContext is set when the underlying JNDIConnection object has it's connect() method invoked.

Returns:
DirContext DirContext, or null if it hasn't been set yet.

connect

public void connect()
Deprecated. 
Establish an external JNDI connection.

If already connected, do nothing.

Throws:
ConnectionException - if an AuthenticationException or NamingException occurs

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Deprecated. 
Disconnect external JNDI connection.

If already disconnected, do nothing.

Throws:
ConnectionException - if a NamingException occurs.

next

public java.lang.Object[] next(long timeoutMs)
                        throws OAException
Deprecated. 
Return the next record from this reader.

It first tests if the underlying search has already executed. If not, it executes it. It then takes the next available result from the executed search, and returns it.
If the result set is empty, then it returns null indicating that the reader is exhausted.

Parameters:
timeoutMs - the maximum time in milli-seconds to wait for data is none is available immediately
Returns:
Object[] containing an IOrderedMap of results, or null
Throws:
OAException

isDry

public boolean isDry()
Deprecated. 
Description copied from interface: IReadConnector
Used to establish whether there is any more data to process. The run implementation of ReadNode returns when this method returns true. The behaviour of the implementation is very much dependent of type of external resource that implementation "talks to", it should only return true if there will never be any more data available, this is different from the scenario where there is is no data at the moment but there maybe in future. The documentation for each implementation should state its specific behaviour.

Returns:
false if the search has not yet been performed or there are still results to be processed then we are not dry
